servinfo.title: Piston, Piston Ring and Connecting Rod Removal and Installation

ptxt.intxrefpoff: Piston, Piston Ring, Connecting Rod and Cylinder Components

item.ptxt: All parts to be installed must be perfectly clean.

Connecting rods, connecting rod bearings, connecting rod bearing caps, pistons and piston rings are in combination sets. Do not disturb such combination and make sure that each part goes back to where it came from, when installing.

s1.ptxt: Remove engine assembly referring to Engine Assembly Removal and Installation .
Remove cylinder head referring to Valve and Cylinder Head Assembly Removal and Installation .
Remove oil pump referring to Oil Pump, Oil Pump Chain and Gasket Holder Plate Removal and Installation .
Remove special tool.
Mark cylinder number on all pistons, connecting rods (1) and connecting rod bearing caps (2) using silver pencil or quick drying paint (3) for installation.
Remove connecting rod bearing caps.
Decarbon top of cylinder bore before removing piston from cylinder.
Push piston and connecting rod assembly out through the top of cylinder bore.
Remove piston pin from connecting rod as follows.

s2.ptxt: Ease out piston pin circlips (1) as shown in figure.

s1.ptxt: Remove connecting rod bearings
Using piston ring expander, remove two compression rings (1st and 2nd) and oil ring from piston, if necessary.

Crank Pin and Connecting Rod Bearings Inspection

s1.ptxt: Decarbonize piston head and ring grooves using a suitable tool.
Install piston ring to piston noting the following, if removed.

item.ptxt: As indicated in figure. 1st and 2nd rings have “TOP” mark respectively. When installing these piston rings to piston, direct marked side of each ring toward top of piston.
1st ring (1) differs from 2nd ring (2) in thickness, shape and color of surface contacting cylinder wall.
Distinguish 1st ring from 2nd ring by as shown in figure.
When installing oil ring, install spring ring (3) first and then rail (4).

s1.ptxt: Assemble connecting rod bearing to connecting rod / bearing cap as follows.

s2.ptxt: Install special tool (B) to special tool (A).
Set connecting rod (1) and bearing (2) to special tool (A) and (B) as shown in figure.
Install connecting rod bearing to connecting rod by pushing special tool (B) as shown in figure.
Set bearing cap (1) and connecting rod bearing (2) to special tool (A) and (B) as shown in figure.
Install bearing to bearing cap by pushing special tool (B) as shown in figure.

s1.ptxt: Assemble piston and connecting rod with piston pin as follows.

s2.ptxt: Apply engine oil to piston pin and piston pin hole of piston (1) and connecting rod (2).
Fit connecting rod to piston so that flat part (4) of connecting rod and arrow mark (3) of piston come on opposite side as shown in figure.
Insert piston pin to piston and connecting rod.
Install piston pin circlips (5) as shown in figure.

s1.ptxt: Apply engine oil to pistons, rings, cylinder walls, connecting rod bearings and crank pins.

attention3.ptxt: Do not apply oil between connecting rod and bearing and between bearing cap and bearing.

s1.ptxt: When installing piston and connecting rod assembly into cylinder bore, point arrow mark (1) on piston head to flywheel side (2).
Distribute end gaps of three piston rings (1st, 2nd and oil rings) as shown in figure.

Install piston and connecting rod assembly into cylinder bore with matching cylinder number marked in removal. Use special tool to compress rings. Guide connecting rod into place on crankshaft. Using a hammer handle (1), tap piston head to install piston into bore. Hold ring compressor firmly against cylinder block until all piston rings have entered cylinder bore.
Install bearing cap (1) to applicable cylinder with matching cylinder number marked in removal, and tighten new connecting rod bearing cap bolts as follows.

s2.ptxt: Tighten all new cap bolts to 20 N·m (2.0 kgf-m, 14.5 lbf-ft).

attention3.ptxt: After tightening bearing cap bolts, check to be sure that crankshaft rotates smoothly.

torqueitem.t-note: Tighten 20 N·m (2.0 kgf-m, 14.5 lbf-ft) and 40° by the specified procedure

s1.ptxt: Turn crankshaft clockwise until key groove (1) comes in middle of two ribs (2) and install special tool (A) to TDC pin hole.
Install oil pump referring to Oil Pump, Oil Pump Chain and Gasket Holder Plate Removal and Installation .
Install oil pan referring to Oil Pan and Oil Pump Strainer Removal and Installation .
Install cylinder head referring to Valve and Cylinder Head Assembly Removal and Installation .
Install timing belt referring to Timing Belt and Belt Tensioner Removal and Installation .
Install engine assembly referring to Engine Assembly Removal and Installation .
